listings.name: Blue Mountain Barrel House
listings.description: By 2011, Blue Mountain beer was in demand across Virginia at a rate that exceeded our capacity at the original Blue Mountain location in Afton.

listings.name: Blue Mountain Brewery
listings.description: Opened in 2007 as the first brewery in Nelson County, Blue Mountain Brewery is a unique destination in the heart of Virginia’s Blue Ridge Mountains.

listings.name: Blue Toad Hard Cider
listings.description: Born in a barn, Blue Toad Cider honors the tradition and legacy of America’s first preferred beverage by brewing an all-natural and eminently drinkable hard cider using locally grown apples in Western New York and apples grown in the Blue Ridge Mountains of Virginia.

listings.name: Bold Rock Hard Cider
listings.description: Our cidery in the heart of the Blue Ridge Mountains is open daily for tours, tastings and hard cider to go.

listings.name: Brewing Tree Beer Company
listings.description: Brewing Tree Beer Company was founded in 2018 by the husband and wife team of Mark and Gina Thompson.

listings.name: Bryant’s Cider & Brewery
listings.description: Our mission is to produce authentic ciders and craft beers using traditional methods while creating an organic and always evolving consumer experience.

listings.name: Devils Backbone Brewing Company
listings.description: Years ago, our founders, Steve and Heidi Crandall, were on a ski trip in the Alps when they tried their first craft beer, a German Weisse at a brewpub.

listings.name: Outback Brew House
listings.description: Join us for a relaxing hand crafted beer at our very own brand new and developing Outback Brew House! Here we serve original recipe beer ice-cold straight from the tap.

listings.name: Three Notch’d Brewery, Distillery & Craft Kitchen

listings.name: Wild Man Dan Brewery
listings.description: Dan brews award winning home crafted ales and enjoys teaching you to do the same.

listings.name: Wood Ridge Farm Brewery

listings.name: Devils Backbone Distilling Co.
listings.description: is the newest addition the Basecamp Brewpub & Meadows in Nelson County, VA.

listings.name: Silverback Distillery
listings.description: Silverback Distillery is the only mother-daughter distilling duo in the nation crafting high-quality, award-winning spirits.

listings.name: Virginia Distillery Co.
listings.description: Our American single malt whisky is crafted in the heart of Virginia’s Blue Ridge Mountains, showcasing both New and Old World whisky-making.

listings.name: Allen Creek Nature Preserve
listings.description: 7 Blaze Color: Yellow Difficulty Level: EASY Directions: Google Maps This nature preserve in the middle of Wintergreen’s community is one of the most unique environments on the mountain.

listings.name: Appalachian Trail from Rt 56 to Harpers Creek
listings.description: 6-mile moderate hike along the Appalachian Trail traverses a wooden Swinging Bridge over the Tye River, and travels through stands of mountain laurel and rhododendron to the Harpers Creek Shelter (AT) and Harper’s Creek, where the water gurgles through the large cascading rocks.

listings.name: Blackrock Trail
listings.description: 8 Blaze Color: Red Difficulty Level: Difficult Directions: Google Maps Blackrock Trail is located on a south-facing slope, which promotes the dry, thin soils along the pedlar gneiss rock formations.

listings.name: Blue Ridge Tunnel
listings.description: Explore Blue Ridge Tunnel in Afton, Virginia.

listings.name: Brimstone Trail
listings.description: 8 Blaze Color: Red Difficulty Level: Difficult Directions: Google Maps The steep and rocky cliffs provide incredible views of Three Ridges Mountain and points to the southwest.

listings.name: Cedar Ciffs North Trail
listings.description: 7 Blaze Color: Red Difficulty Level: Moderate to Difficult Directions: Google Maps This trail is parallel to the Cedar Cliffs Main trail on a north- facing slope.

listings.name: Chestnut Springs Trail
listings.description: 1 Blaze Color: Yellow-Red Difficulty Level: Moderate Directions: Google Maps The north end of the trail leaves the stream and yellow birches and rhododendron of the Shamokin Gorge and enters oak-hickory forest type.

listings.name: Crabtree Falls
listings.description: Crabtree Falls This popular attraction is located in Nelson County, Virginia, just six miles off the scenic Blue Ridge Parkway near milepost 27.

listings.name: Devils Knob Trail
listings.description: 6 Blaze Color: Yellow-Red Difficulty Level: Moderate Directions: Google Maps The trail begins at the Blue Ridge Overlook.

listings.name: Fortune’s Cove Nature Preserve
listings.description: 3 Difficulty Level: Difficult Fortune’s Cove provides two loops that reward visitors with stunning mountain vistas.

listings.name: Fortune’s Ridge Trail
listings.description: 1 Blaze Color: Red Difficulty Level: Moderate to Difficult Directions: Google Maps Fortunes Ridge Trail follows a cold mountain stream over cascading rock formations.

listings.name: Hemlock Springs Loop
listings.description: 8 Blaze Color: Yellow-Red Difficulty Level: Moderate to Difficult Directions: Google Maps This trail is one of the only areas that provides habitat for both pink and yellow ladyslippers.

listings.name: Highlands Leisure Trail
listings.description: 5 Blaze Color: Yellow Difficulty Level: Easy Directions: Google Maps The Highlands Leisure Trail is the popular connecting trail between the resort’s Blackrock Village and the Wintergarden.

listings.name: Humpback Rocks
listings.description: The Humpback Rocks Visitors Center is located at milemarker 5.

listings.name: James River State Park
listings.description: James River State Park features over 15 miles of hiking/biking/horseback riding trails that meander through 1500 acres of rolling meadows and quiet forests.

listings.name: Kids in Parks: Virginia Blue Ridge Railway Trail
listings.description: This Blue Ridge Parkway Foundation program helps get kids and families “un-plugged”, outdoors and actively engaged in nature, for their health and the health of our parks.

listings.name: Laurel Ridge Loop
listings.description: 6 Blaze Color: Yellow Difficulty Level: Moderate Directions: Google Maps The loop layout of the trail provides access to an array of forest types: mountain laurel thickets, yellow birch, hemlock remains, and oak-hickory forest.

listings.name: Lower Shamokin Falls Trail
listings.description: 7 Blaze Color: Blue Difficulty Level: Moderate Perhaps the longest destination hike on the property, the trail begins on a jeep trail and then meanders through dense forest cover.

listings.name: Mau-Har Trail
listings.description: The blue blazed Mau-Har trail provides an excellent circuit hike in conjunction with the Appalachian Trail through the Three Ridges Wilderness area in Nelson County.

listings.name: Montebello Nature Trail
listings.description: 5 mile) follows a small stream that was once part of the Montebello Fish Hatchery.

listings.name: Nelson County Wilderness Area
listings.description: The Wilderness designation provides permanent protection for the two areas in their natural state.

listings.name: North Fork of the Piney River
listings.description: A scenic driving and short walking trail offers views of Piney River as it cascades over large rocks.

listings.name: Old Appalachian Trail
listings.description: 3 Blaze Color: Red-Yellow Difficulty Level: Moderate to Difficult Directions: Google Maps This trail has an array of access points and varying hike lengths.

listings.name: Paul’s Creek Trail
listings.description: 6 Blaze Color: Blue Difficulty Level: Moderate Directions: Google Maps Family favorite! At the end of this valley hike near Crawford’s Knob is a series of cascading waterfalls.

listings.name: Pedlars Edge Trail
listings.description: 6 Blaze Color: Red Difficulty Level: Difficult Directions: Google Maps The Pedlars Edge trail connects to the Blackrock Trail.

listings.name: Pond Hollow Trail
listings.description: 0 Blaze Color: Red Difficulty Level: Difficult Directions: Google Maps Pond Hollow is one of the most interesting and challenging trails on the mountain.

listings.name: Ravens Roost Park
listings.description: 5 Blaze Color: Yellow Difficulty Level: Moderate Directions: Google Maps This trail is excellent for finding wildflowers during warmer months.

listings.name: Shamokin Springs Nature Preserve
listings.description: 3 Blaze Color: Yellow Difficulty Level: Easy Directions: Google Maps This nature preserve in the middle of Wintergreen’s community is one of the most unique environments on the mountain.

listings.name: The Plunge
listings.description: 2 Blaze Color: Yellow Difficulty Level: Moderate (if you take your time) Directions: Google Maps One of the shortest trails on the mountain (it is an access trail to the Blackrock Trail), The Plunge is an excellent introduction to the beauty and natural history of the area.

listings.name: Trillium Field
listings.description: 1 Blaze Color: Yellow Difficulty Level: Easy Directions: Google Maps In early May the bloom from thousands of trillium blanket the forest floor with white and pink.

listings.name: Upper Shamokin Falls Trail
listings.description: 4 Blaze Color: Yellow Difficulty Level: Easy Directions: Google Maps One of the most popular and beautiful hikes on the mountain.

listings.name: Upper Shamokin Gorge Trail
listings.description: 8 Blaze Color: Red Difficulty Level: Difficult Directions: Google Maps One of the more beautiful and challenging hikes on the mountain, the Gorge Trail starts on Laurel Springs Drive near Wolftrap Lane where it follows and crosses the headwaters of Stoney Creek at several spots.

listings.name: White Oak Trail
listings.description: 5 Blaze Color: Yellow Difficulty Level: Moderate Directions: Google Maps This trail is excellent for finding wildflowers during warmer months.

listings.name: White Rock Falls

listings.name: Three Ridges

listings.name: Oak Ridge Loop

listings.name: Woodson's Mill Loop
listings.description: Begins and ends at Woodson’s Mill on Route 778, just off Route 56 in the Lowesville area.

listings.name: Walton's Mountain Museum Loop

listings.name: Virginia Blue Ridge Railway Trail
listings.description: 7 miles This trail is open for hiking, biking and horseback riding year round.

listings.name: Nelson Scenic Loop
listings.description: The Nelson Scenic Loop is a 50-mile auto and bike tour that features Nelson County’s bounty of natural, cultural, and historic attractions.

listings.name: Tye River
listings.description: Photo credit: Wyatt GreeneWith headwaters beginning high in the Blue Ridge Mountains and the George Washington National Forest, the Tye River is one of the most beautiful whitewater streams in Virginia.

listings.name: James River
listings.description: Photo credit: Wyatt GreeneThe James River forms the southeastern border of Nelson County, and is the longest and largest of Virginia’s rivers, draining the center of Virginia, from the Appalachian Mountains to the Chesapeake Bay.

listings.name: Rockfish River
listings.description: Photo credit: NobtyerThe Rockfish River is formed in Nelson County, Virginia, by the confluence of its North and South Forks (37°54′13″N 78°49′58″W), both of which rise in the Blue Ridge Mountains near the Blue Ridge Parkway.

listings.name: Lake Nelson
listings.description: Lake Nelson is a 40-acre impoundment located in Nelson County, Virginia.

listings.name: Fishing the Tye River
listings.description: 4-mile-long tributary of the James River in central Virginia originating on the eastern slope of the Blue Ridge Mountains in Nelson County, and is fed by the Piney and Buffalo rivers.

listings.name: Fishing the James River
listings.description: From the confluence of the Jackson and Cowpasture Rivers in Botetourt County, downstream to Richmond, the James River offers a wide range of angling opportunities and settings.

listings.name: Fishing the Little Piney River
listings.description: Little Piney River is a stream located at the junction of Rt.

listings.name: Fishing the South Rockfish River
listings.description: The Rockfish River (South) is stocked with catchable-sized trout periodically by the Department of Wildlife Resources from October through May.

listings.name: Fishing at Montebello
listings.description: Take the kids to Montebello and catch some Rainbow Trout in the fee base trout ponds.

listings.name: Fishing at Lake Monocan Park
listings.description: Photo credit: Wintergreen ResortLake Monocan is a 20-acre lake and park located at Stoney Creek in Nellysford.

listings.name: Fishing at Lake Nelson
listings.description: Lake Nelson is a 40-acre impoundment located in Nelson County, Virginia.

listings.name: Wintergreen Resort Fishing
listings.description: Nestled in 11,000 acres in the Blue Ridge Mountains, WINTERGREEN RESORT is in close proximity to some of the best fly fishing Virginia has to offer.

listings.name: Devils Knob Golf Course
listings.description: When Ellis Maples designed this 18 hole gem, the highest golf course in Virginia, his challenge was to enhance its stunning Blue Ridge Mountain setting.

listings.name: Stoney Creek Golf Course
listings.description: Golf year round in the Rockfish River valley on the 27-hole Rees Jones Design Stoney Creek Golf Course.

listings.name: Soaring
listings.description: Explore Soaring in Nelson County, Virginia.

listings.name: Skiing & Snowboarding
listings.description: Explore Skiing & Snowboarding in Wintergreen, Virginia.

listings.name: Tennis
listings.description: Wintergreen Resort Tennis Magazine has ranked Wintergreen among the nation’s top 50 tennis programs for the past 18 years, and in 2010 awarded the distinction of being the #1 resort for families in the United States.

listings.name: Swimming
listings.description: Wintergreen Resort Wintergreen Resort has facilities for indoor and outdoor swimming with indoor facilities available year-round.

listings.description: A new vision has come to life at one of the most beautiful locations in all of Virginia.

listings.name: Afton Mountain Vineyards

listings.name: Caihailian Vineyard
listings.description: Caihailian Vineyard is owned by Bob and Anne Ramsey, and is named for their three fantastic kids.

listings.name: Cardinal Point Winery
listings.description: Family owned and operated, Cardinal Point Vineyard and Winery lies in the beautiful foothills of the Blue Ridge, in the shadow of Afton Mountain.

listings.name: Flying Fox Vineyards
listings.description: Is to honor the emerging Virginia Wine industry with unique expressions of Varietal character and authenticity of place, but also to push our own limits and comfort levels with wine making that is uninhibited by history or convention Our limited production and sharp focus create not only a consis...

listings.name: Hill Top Winery & Meadery
listings.description: Since 1998 we have specialized in wine made from fruit other than grapes.

listings.name: Lovingston Winery
listings.description: Lovingston Winery opened in 2003 as a small batch 100% estate grown vineyard and winery located in the rolling countryside of the Blue Ridge Mountains.

listings.name: Mountain and Vine Winery
listings.description: Photo credit: Lucy Jalin PhotographyMountain and Vine Vineyards & Winery is located in the Monticello AVA wine region.

listings.name: Mountain Cove Vineyards & Winery
listings.description: Located next to The Nature Conservancy’s Fortunes Cove Preserve.

listings.name: Valley Road Vineyards
listings.description: Founded in 2015, Valley Road Vineyards was conceived by a group of friends who brought talents from successful careers in law, advertising, insurance, real estate development, and writing, among others.

listings.name: Veritas Vineyards & Winery
listings.description: Our philosophy is to make wine with the classic, old-world principles of viticulture and vinification, at the same time using state of the art technology to capture varietal and regional character.

listings.name: Quarry Gardens at Schuyler
listings.description: Natural area and botanical garden for public education and enjoyment.

listings.name: Montebello Fish Hatchery
listings.description: Montebello Fish Hatchery hosts numerous visitors and school group tours throughout the year.

listings.name: Walton’s Mountain Museum
listings.description: The Walton’s Mountain Museum showcases the television show of the 1960s, “The Waltons”.

listings.name: Big Arms Farm

listings.name: Caldwell Farms
listings.description: You pick flower farm in beautiful Nelson County, VA.

listings.name: Davis Creek Farm
listings.description: Davis Creek Farm is a sixty-acre working family farm located in a pristine hollow in the Blue Ridge Mountains of Virginia.

listings.name: Deer Creek Farm
listings.description: Custom beef and lamb by whole, half, or quarter.

listings.name: Edible Landscaping
listings.description: Located high in the foothills of the Blue Ridge Mountains, you’ll find plants and trees that produce edible food – berries, nuts, fruits, herbs; items that we distribute worldwide.

listings.name: Fitzgerald Farms
listings.description: Pick-Your-Own Pumpkins during the fall season and sweet corn during the summer.

listings.name: Fitzgerald’s Orchard
listings.description: Red and Golden Delicious, Gala, Rome, Granny Smith, Fuji and Pink Lady’s apples available in season.

listings.name: HeartRock Retreat & Homestead
listings.description: Welcome to HeartRock! Located in Nelson County, Virginia, our fifteen acre homestead offers both rustic charm and modern comfort.

listings.name: Hungry Hill Farm
listings.description: Our farm is open year around for visitors and groups.

listings.name: Inglewood Fine Meats
listings.description: We take pride in the fact that our Beef and Lamb is not only Verified All Natural, but our animals live a quality life in the foothills of the blue ridge mountains.

listings.name: Lost Point Farm
listings.description: Situated on a rocky knob above the Tye River, Lost Point Farm was established in 2010.

listings.name: One Forest
listings.description: Forest Farm – One Forest is a forest farm and woodland activity space where people from all walks of life can gather to play, experience, and learn from nature.

listings.name: Pharsalia
listings.description: Built in 1814 at the foot of dePriest Mountain in Nelson County, Virginia, by William Massie, Pharsalia commands stunning views and is surrounded by original outbuildings and lovely gardens.

listings.name: Robinia Institute
listings.description: FROM THE SOUL TO THE SOIL Reawakening the Wild Founded in 2017 as the educational and consulting center of Timshel Wildland, a 400-acre process-led & emergent conservation landscape in Virginia, Robinia’s mission is to advocate, educate, and demonstrate the abundance, joy, and regenerative power ...

listings.description: Tinkerland Farm is a family farm located across the road from Bryant Ln on Rt 151 in Nelson County, Virginia.

listings.name: Turnip the Beets Farm
listings.description: Our small farm business is owned and operated by Shane and Beverly Spanninger.

listings.name: Virginia Chestnuts
listings.description: We’re providers of quality, Virginia-grown chestnuts, located in beautiful Nelson County.

listings.name: Kids in Parks: Rockfish River Trailhead
listings.description: The Rockfish Valley Kids in Parks Track Trail in Nellysford at the Rockfish Valley Foundation’s beautiful Rockfish River Trailhead on Route 151, 1.

listings.description: Located in Montebello, Appalachian Horse Adventures offers a riding experience for everyone – from children as young as 6, who have dreamed of being on horseback, to experienced trail riders looking to explore the scenic Blue Ridge Mountains and ford the Tye River.

listings.name: Rebel's Run at Afton Mountain
listings.description: Offering trail rides, English and Western lessons and summer camps.

listings.name: Oakland Museum
listings.description: The Oakland Museum is in a historic tavern with exhibits on Rural Electrification in Nelson County in the 1930s and Hurricane Camille and its devastation on Nelson County in 1969.

listings.name: Oak Ridge Estate
listings.description: Photo credit: Eric KelleyThe mansion on this 5,000-acre plantation estate was first built in 1802 and acquired at the turn of the 20th century by Thomas Fortune Ryan, a Nelson County native who had become one of the 10 wealthiest men in the nation.

listings.name: Swannanoa
listings.description: Swannanoa was built in 1911 by Major James H.

listings.name: Woodson's Mill
listings.description: Woodson’s Mill has been owned and loved by a small handful of families since its construction in 1794, when Guiliford Campbell built the original four-story, 32 foot square building.

listings.name: Brew Ridge Trail
listings.description: The Brew Ridge Trail is a self-guided tour featuring six of the nation’s best craft breweries.

listings.name: Nelson 151
listings.description: Located at the base of the Blue Ridge, Route 151 is Main Street for the Rockfish Valley.

listings.name: Nelson 29
